main event: On 3/22/58 at 02:20 Z in Denton, Nebraska, a ground-radar observation reported seeing one object moving very rapidly in the opposite direction, emitting a close-up silver white light with no sound. The observation concluded that it was probably a balloon.
interesting points: The object was described as oval shaped with red lights at a distance, the size of a tennis ball, and as large as a cabin plane close up.
Witnesses mentioned extreme brightness of the light and a whirring noise resembling two propeller-driven planes without exhaust noise.
Multiple aircraft departures and arrivals were recorded during the sighting period, along with specific weather and winds-aloft conditions.
Observers included individuals of various ages and professions from Lincoln, Nebraska.
The document contains handwritten notes indicating that several aircraft and a bright flashing light were seen, followed by the appearance of jets taking off.
sighted object: one object with an oval shape emitting silver white light
